19001.title: Registration
19001.description: Get your badge, grab some coffee, and network.

19002.title: Welcome
19002.description: Welcome from GDG Organizers. Get a sense of tracks and options. Then off we go..

19100.title: Hackathon Day 1
19100.description: Hackathon Begins. Teams talk to your mentors, and away you go.

20100.title: Hackathon Day 2
20100.description: Hackathon Begins. Teams talk to your mentors, and away you go.

20101.title: Hackathon: Pitch Prep
20101.description: Dry-runs for final presentations. Feedback from coaches!

20102.title: Hackathon: Presentations
20102.description: Teams present their pitches and prototypes!

20103.title: Hackathon: Audience & Judges Decision
20103.description: Judges Deliberate. Audience votes, completes survey!

20104.title: Hackathon: Survey & Prizes
20104.description: Present final prizes! Raffle for audience.

19201.title: How to create a Startup with Angular 2 and Firebase
19201.description: Come up with an idea and make it true is not easy. Combining the latest version of Angular and Firebase you'll have the tools and infrastructure you need to build your idea and make it grow.

19202.title: Introducing the GSuite APIs
19202.description: You may be familiar with Google's G Suite suite of productivity applications like Google Drive, Sheets, Calendar, Slides, Gmail, etc. But in addition to their user interfaces, each of these products also has a developer API. In this talk, we'll introduce you to the APIs so that you can dream up an application to make daily work even more efficient, whether it be a web or mobile app. Access to our APIs is enabled through a set of Client Libraries for a variety of languages. Users who may have tried & failed, run into roadblocks, been confused about using our APIs, or had security issues may find solutions to those issues in this talk. To keep things interesting, we'll attempt to do live demos of most of the APIs.

19203.title: Tools & Libraries for Progressive Web Apps
19203.description: Jeff will cover Lighthouse, an automated test suite that helps guides developers on their Progressive Web App journey. He'll also explain how service worker libraries can jumpstart your Progressive Web App development, making it easier to create web apps that load instantly while following best practices.

19204.title: Starry Night with TensorFlow
19204.description: Deep Learning has led to impressive results in image classification, but can also be used to explore new possibilities in art. In this talk, I'll introduce Deep Learning using examples in TensorFlow, and demo open source code you can use to train your own image classifier, and create your own dreamlike and blended artwork. At the end, I'll share my favorite educational resources you can use to learn more about machine learning, and of course all about TensorFlow.

19205.title: Engineering Open Source Machine Learning Software
19205.description: This talk lays out the principles guiding the design of scikit-learn, focussing on usability and maintainability. I'm also discussing some continuing challenges, like feature creep and increasing complexity, and future directions.

19206.title: Cloud Machine Learning APIs for fun and profit with Harry Potter
19206.description: The entranceways to the dorms at Hogwarts were guarded by paintings that talked and asked for passwords. In this talk, see a real-world Harry Potter style personal 'security' system that can understand spoken passwords and see the people and objects that wish to gain entrance. Learn about how machine learning APIs will enable the next generation of smart devices, and explore other applications of machine learning in the real-world, both in present and in the future.

19207.title: Fireside Chat: Sree Srinivasan, Chief Digial Office (NYC)
19207.description: A conversation on 'How we're making NYC the most tech-friendly, most transparent and most digitally-equitable city in the world'

19208.title: Panel: What's Next For Machine Learning?
19208.description: What's next for machine learning? We'll discuss its usage and future in deep learning, open source, computer vision, media advertising and conversational commerce.

19209.title: Android Continuous Integration
19209.description: Automatising the build and release project will save you time and prevent you from manual mistakes… as long as it is done correctly. This talk will explore which tools and techniques you should use to automatise your Android project and how to correctly apply Continuous Integration – from Jenkins to Gradle scripting – and provide useful tricks and release strategies. Android testing will be showcased and the talk will also propose strategies on how and when apply tests in conjunction with a CI process.

19210.title: Intro to Kubernetes
19210.description: This on-demand community webinar is a perfect opportunity for anyone from a software engineering or systems / DevOps background to learn about Kubernetes fundamentals — including the history, origins and technical architecture of this exciting open source software project that is changing the game for Internet-scale computing in organizations of all sizes.

19211.title: Firebase Primitives
19211.description: Firebase helps mobile and web developers create extraordinary apps. It abstracts complex infrastructure and simplifies the development process. By using Firebase, developers can build the best user experience in the shortest amount of time, all without having to spin up servers or manage infrastructure. We explore how Firebase authenticates users and synchronizes data by creating an app on stage. You’ll experience first hand how easy it is to build with Firebase!

19212.title: Firebase Analytics
19212.description: At the heart of Firebase is Firebase Analytics, a free and unlimited analytics tool that provides insight into app usage and user engagement. In this talk, you will learn how to optimize usage of your apps with the various tools and integrations that Firebase Analytics offers. We'll also look at  some of the cool new features that have been announced since I/O

20201.title: Android and the Seven Dwarfs
20201.description: Android is a great OS and it's Java based programming environment has offered an easy learning curve, great adaptation but also brought its own pitfalls and problems. The httpclient shipped with android is buggy and outdated, Java's programming model does not encourage developers to use separate threads for non-ui related tasks, use of anonymous inner classes for listeners create a burden and ugly code and of course this list goes on. This talk will focus on seven great open source libraries which do fix Android's programming model, the way jquery fixes javascript. The libraries will be covered with example code, advantages, disadvantages, internals and when to use them.

20202.title: Realm - A New Mobile Database and Object Framework
20202.description: So you need to store data in your mobile application? Great, now you need to work with SQLite. Writing SQL is great fun if you enjoy thinking about mapping your objects to a relational store over and over and over. But what if there was another solution? One that allowed you to work with objects and store them as such with a powerful query system. No transformations back and forth to a relational store. Well, you’re in luck, one does exist: Realm. Realm is a mobile object (MVCC) database that can do all of these things and more. In this session learn how you can rid yourself of SQL, SQLite and its binding chains so you can harness the power and speed of working with native objects in Realm.

20203.title: Smoke and Mirrors in Android UI
20203.description: Have you ever watched a trick and wondered, how did they do that? I wonder the same when using some great apps. In this talk I am going to talk about some of the smoke and mirrors used in the framework and one of my favorite apps: Google photos. I will show you some of the tricks behind them and how you can use them in your app!

20204.title: Introduction to Google Flutter
20204.description: Have you heard of Flutter? Chances are no! Get a head start and learn about this upcoming technology that lets you write native apps running 60fps on both iOS and Android with the same codebase!

20205.title: Google AMP At Scale
20205.description: Google AMP (Accelerated Mobile Pages) makes the mobile web faster and predictable. Come learn about themotivations, challenges and outcomes of implementing Google AMP across 10 digital publications.

20206.title: Polymer 2.0: What is it, why do you care, when can you take it home.
20206.description: Polymer 2.0 is coming, look busy... Together we'll remember how the W3C has given us four really awesome news specs that come together like Voltron to empower front end developers like never before. We'll also look at how we've been making use of these powers, and the responsibilities that come with them, at PhotoShelter where web components continue to been a central part of major modernization work. Then we'll peer into the future and take a look at what's on deck with Polymer 2.0, some of the great new tools that will come with it, and how you too can start building the future, today!

20207.title: A Dose of GraphQL: A Cure for Ar-REST-ed Development
20207.description: GraphQL is a specification developed by Facebook that brings a more declarative approach to APIs than the current standard, REST. Come for a discussion of core GraphQL concepts, as well as lessons learned from using it in production at vogue.com. No knowledge of GraphQL is needed, but a basic knowledge of REST APIs will be helpful.

20208.title: ngmeta gotchu: SEO Performance in Angular
20208.description: In most JS frameworks, having dynamic metadata driven by route dependencies can be tricky. In most cases Google (and other search engines) will run an AJAX Crawl, and your JS to update the page may not work. In this talk we will go over the value of SEO, how to implement dynamic metadata, and a quick bit on how to make sure you're getting crawled correctly.

20209.title: Interactive UI for Complex (and Unusual) Data with D3.js
20209.description: D3.js empowers developers to bring complex data to life. I will first give a brief introduction to this popular JavaScript library. Then I will dive deep into two unconventional use cases: the newly launched interactive theatre seating charts on Broadway.com and a dashboard for legislative data from the US Congress.

19301.title: Getting Started with Kubernetes
19301.description: Kubernetes has become the Linux kernel for distributed application design and hosting. In this workshop we cover the different options for installing Kubernetes on a cloud and on a laptop. The attendees onboard a sample application to Kubernetes and learn about the most salient features. This session will also cover the use cases for Kubernetes and some of the most recent case studies.

19302.title: Android Performance Workshop
19302.description: We will be going through an interactive workshop fixing common performance issues.  Topics will include: speeding up json serialization, scroll performance and startup time.

19303.title: VR / AR / MR / 360 - Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
19303.description: Lex Dreitser (Certified Unity® Developer) and special guests, will bring you abreast with Google's Daydream, Microsoft's HoloLens and every other major VR / AR / 360 product in the industry. He'll show you how to develop for every VR/AR platform, and inspire you not with his ability to quickly create VR/AR, but with yours...  If you bring your laptop with Unity (free) installed - you'll be able to follow along and see that it's really not magic!  No experience necessary the most novice and most experienced will all find this talk helpful.

19304.title: Crash Course: React and Redux
19304.description: This introductory workshop will show you the basics of using React, a popular JavaScript UI library. We'll create React components and learn how to implement Redux, a flux-based library that holds our application state, to consume and display data from a third-party API. You'll walk away armed with knowledge and a sweet mini-app!

20301.title: Tensor Flow & Deep Learning (without a Phd)
20301.description: Google has recently open-sourced its framework for machine learning and neural networks called Tensorflow. With this new tool, deep machine learning transitions from an area of research into mainstream software engineering. In this session, we will teach you how to choose the right neural network for your problem and how to make it behave. Familiarity with differential equations is no longer required. Instead, a couple of lines of Tensor Flow Python, and a bag of `tricks of the trade` will do the job. No previous Python knowledge required,

20302.title: Pixel perfect and practical: Everyday Android design workflows
20302.description: In this session, we'll explore some common everyday workflows involved in Android design and walk through them step by step. (More details coming soon)

20303.title: Sketchfab: Developing for 3D and WebVR
20303.description: Sketchfab is the leading platform for publishing and sharing 3D models and Virtual Reality scenes. In this session, we will give a brief overview of the Sketchfab APIs and show off some in-the-wild examples.

20304.title: Getting started with WebRTC
20304.description: From API to codecs, main things you need to know to start integrating WebRTC on your projects.

20305.title: Scratch your Blockly Itch: How to run an Hour of Code
20305.description: Scratch and Blockly are visual programming environments that are popular for teaching beginners to code. But they are also tools for creating fun and familiar experiences for new classes of devices. In this talk I'll share my experiences with these platorms as well as tips & insights for running an Hour of Code in December.
